Sentencas: This work examines the possibility of using hydrogen titanate materials, which may exhibit appreciable protonic conductivity at low temperatures (100-500 degreesC), as electrolytes in the next generation of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The ramsdellite lithium titanate phase, Li2Ti3O7 was used as a basis for H+ exchange to form H2Ti3O7.
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The ramsdellite structure of this compound was confirmed by X-ray diffraction and its composition confirmed by thermogravimetric analysis.
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Magic angle spinning solid state NMR showed that the protons occupied at least two sites in the ramsdellite structure, in accord with the proposed H2Ti3O7 formula.
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The conductivity of compressed compacts of this compound was measured and the bulk value extracted.
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The measured conductivity of H2Ti3O7 was 2.66 x 10(-6)
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: S cm(-1) at 200 degreesC, about one order of magnitude lower than the Li analogue Li2Ti3O7, and two orders of magnitude lower than the best perovskite ceramic proton conductors at this temperature.
Titulo: Hydrogen titanates as potential proton conducting fuel cell electrolytes
